contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox former political post | border = vice-regal | political_office = Governor | country = [[Colonial Fiji|Fiji]] | insignia = Flag of Fiji 1924-1970.svg | insigniasize = 220px | insigniacaption = [[Flag of Fiji]] from 1924 to 1970 | first_officeholder = The Rt Hon. [[Hercules Robinson, 1st Baron Rosmead|Hercules Robinson]] | last_officeholder = The Rt Hon. [[Robert Sidney Foster]] | style = [[Excellency|His Excellency]] [[The Right Honourable]] | appointer = [[Monarchy of the United Kingdom|King/Queen of the United Kingdom]] | began = 10 October 1874 | ended = 10 October 1970 }} {{Politics of Fiji}} Fiji was a [[United Kingdom|British]] [[Colonial Fiji|Crown Colony]] from 1874 to 1970, and an independent [[Dominion of Fiji|Dominion]] in the [[Commonwealth of Nations|British Commonwealth]] from 1970 to 1987. During this period, the [[List of heads of state of Fiji|Head of State]] was the British Monarch, but in practice his or her functions were normally exercised locally by the [[Governor]] prior to independence (on 10 October 1970), and by the [[List of Governors-General of Fiji|Governor-General]] prior to the proclamation of a republic on 7 October 1987. Note that from 1877 to 3 July 1952, Governors of Fiji were also [[High Commissioner for the Western Pacific|High Commissioners for the Western Pacific]]. ==Governors of Fiji (1874–1970)== {| class="wikitable" ! From ! To !style="width: 30%;"| Name !style="width: 30%;"| Comments |- | 10 October 1874 | June 1875 | Sir [[Hercules Robinson, 1st Baron Rosmead|Hercules Robinson]] | |- | June 1875 | January 1880 | Sir [[Arthur Hamilton-Gordon, 1st Baron Stanmore|Arthur Hamilton Gordon]] | |- | January 1880 | December 1886 | Sir [[William Des Vœux]] | |- | January 1887 | February 1888 | Sir [[Charles Mitchell (governor)|Charles Mitchell]] | |- | February 1888 | 7 February 1897 | Sir [[John Bates Thurston]] | |- | February 1897 | 1901 | Sir [[George Thomas Michael O'Brien]] | |- | 1901 | 10 September 1902 | Sir [[William Allardyce]] | Acting |- | 10 September 1902 | 11 October 1904 | Sir [[Henry Moore Jackson]] | |- | 11 October 1904 | 21 February 1911 | Sir [[Everard F. im Thurn]] | |- | 21 February 1911 | 25 July 1912 | Sir [[Francis Henry May]] | |- | 25 July 1912 | 10 October 1918 | Sir [[Ernest Bickham Sweet-Escott]] | |- | 10 October 1918 | 25 April 1925 | Sir [[Cecil Hunter Rodwell]] | |- | 25 April 1925 | 22 November 1929 | Sir [[Eyre Hutson]] | |- | 22 November 1929 | 28 November 1936 | Sir [[Arthur George Murchison Fletcher]] | |- | 28 November 1936 | August 1938 | Sir [[Arthur Richards, 1st Baron Milverton|Arthur Richards]] | |- | 16 September 1938 | 21 July 1942 | Sir [[Harry Luke]] | |- | 21 July 1942 | 1 January 1945 | Sir [[Philip Euen Mitchell]] | |- | 1 January 1945 | 1946 | Sir [[Alexander Grantham]] | |- | 20 January 1948 | 6 October 1952 | Sir [[Leslie Brian Freeston]] | |- | 6 October 1952 | 28 October 1958 | Sir [[Ronald Garvey]] | |- | 28 October 1958 | 6 January 1964 | Sir [[Kenneth Maddocks]] | |- | 6 January 1964 | December 1968 | Sir [[Derek Jakeway]] | |- | December 1968 | 10 October 1970 | Sir [[Robert Sidney Foster]] | |} In 1970, Fiji gained independence from the [[United Kingdom]]. After independence, the viceroy in Fiji was the [[Governor-General of Fiji]]. ==See also== *[[Governor-General of Fiji]] *[[List of heads of state of Fiji]] [[Category:Lists of governors|Fiji, Governors]] [[Category:History of Fiji]] [[Category:Politics of Fiji]] [[Category:Government of Fiji]] [[Category:Governors of Fiji| ]]
